data.title: Best Time To Visit Switzerland (2020)
data.meta_description: Find the best time to visit Switzerland. Check the ideal time of the year to visit Switzerland, weather in Switzerland, best month to visit Switzerland, current temperature.
data.text:
Winter season starts from December and continues till March when the country receives a great amount of snowfall along with snowstorms. The onset of winter begins early in Switzerland from early November. However, the summer season is ideal for those planning to explore the coastal charm of lakes in Switzerland. Between May and September, honeymooners can frolic on the lakeside beaches and take cruises. Given below is the month-wise analysis of the weather in Switzerland.Â

June to August (19Â°C to 32Â°C): The duration from June to August constitutes the summer season. This season in Switzerland is a great time to indulge in outdoor sports like hiking, camping, and boating. Lake Geneva region is a popular haunt for holidaymakers and adventure lovers. From cable car rides to cruises, itâs a wonderful time to explore the natural beauty of destinations in Switzerland. Highlights: Sightseeing, Hiking, Boat Tours, City Tours, Paddle Boarding, Sky Dining, Bernina Express Ride, Kayaking

Switzerland to November (7Â°C to 20Â°C): Autumn or fall in Switzerland is mildly chilly during the night. Average temperatures range between 14 to 25 degrees and summer crowds begin to recede. The slopes of the Swiss Alps in the countryside show beautiful colors. Itâs the best time to explore Interlaken and Mount Jungfrau.Â

Highlights: Wine Tasting, Cable Car RideÂ

December to February (2Â°C to 6Â°C): Plenty of adventures in Switzerland like skiing await in the winter season for those looking to explore the Swiss Alps in snowfall. Christmas and New Year season brings scores of honeymooners and families to popular attractions in Interlaken and Geneva. Besides exploring the major attractions, tourists can also grab a chance to experience some of the best festivals in Switzerland. Paleo, Gauklerfest, and Montreux Jazz festivals can be enjoyed in the summer season, while International Balloon Festival can be enjoyed in the winter season. And, if horsepower excites someone, then the popular Geneva International Motor Show held in March can be one of the best reasons to head towards Switzerland.Â

Highlights: Snowboarding, Skiing, Snowfall, Winter Kayaking, Sledging

March to May (11Â°C to 20Â°C): As the snow starts to melt away with the onset of the spring season, the landscape of Switzerland comes to life with fresh bloom. Accommodation is mostly cheaper than other seasons and the weather is usually clear.

Highlights:Â Budget accommodation, Cable Car RideGiven below is the month-wise segregation of all the major festivals celebrated in Switzerland.

Spring Season: April and May are the months of the spring season. Most of the snow has cleared by now and one can easily go hiking on the most gorgeous hiking trails in Switzerland. During these months one can get cheaper hotels and tickets as the touristâs footfall is less.Â Â

Early Summer Season: The Switzerland summer is mainly in the months of June, July, August, and September. The days are usually longer than the nights during this time of the year. June is the month of the early summer season.Â

Summer Season: The temperature in Switzerland in August may rise as high as 24Â°C, and therefore it is the hottest month in Switzerland. July and August are the high seasons when people can enjoy various activities like hiking, biking, paragliding, and others. September also offers the same activities but at a lower temperature.

There is no definite rainy season in Switzerland. However, the summer season is the time when most of the rains take place in Switzerland. The temperature in Switzerland in August is between 20 degrees Celsius to 28 degrees Celsius and has the maximum humidity. It is the wettest season in Switzerland with an average of 120mm of rainfall. Other summer months may also experience light showers at any time of the day. Hiking and other activities are not recommended during rainfall, but as the monsoons in Switzerland cannot be predicted, one must keep their fingers crossed to get the best weather in Switzerland.

Thus, it would be right to say that the best time to visit Switzerland is during the summer season when one can enjoy all kinds of activities offered by the place. Switzerlandâs winter months are also amazing to visit if one wants to experience snowfall and activities like skiing. However, an ideal time to visit Switzerland is during the fall and the spring season, that is, the months between the summer and the winter season as these months experience low touristsâ season of Switzerland due to which all the fares and hotel rates are quite low during this time of the year, making a personâs trip cheap and reasonable. The weather in Switzerland throughout the year is ideal for any kind of vacation or holiday.

The winter season is the best time to visit Switzerland for snow. The winter season in Switzerland is from October to March.

Fall Season: Switzerlandâs climate in October is quite mild and therefore, it is the low season. Novembers are usually chilly, and activities like biking, paragliding are stopped.Â

Early Winters: December is all about Christmas. The place emits holiday vibes. The months of January and February are the Switzerland snowfall months when the temperature is lowest, and one gets to see the place covered in snow. Switzerlandâs winter months are most suitable for snow activities like skiing. Many ski restaurants increase their prices for tourists during this time of the year. Hiking is also possible during this season but only at lower altitudes.

Peak Winters: Months of January and February are the peak winter season months. The days are short and the entire area is covered in snow. If you want to see the winter sports than plan a visit to Switzerland in the months of January and February.Â

Early Spring: With March approaching, Switzerland enters into the early spring season. Most of the regions still face chilly weather conditions.Â Â Â
